title: 'Photo-op, Truth posts': Why PM Modi avoided Trump’s calls, Washington invite
content: The last officially acknowledged phone call between PM Modi and Trump took place on June 17, when Trump left the G7 Summit in Canada abruptly and flew back to Washington. A bilateral meeting between the two leaders, planned on the sidelines of the summit, had to be cancelled. During that call, Trump invited PM Modi to stop over in Washington.

title: Dhankhar applies for pension; seeks MLA benefits - why was it stopped in 2019
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, after resigning as Vice President citing health issues, has applied to resume his pension as a former legislator in Rajasthan. He previously received this pension until becoming the governor of West Bengal in 2019. Now 74, Dhankhar is entitled to a monthly pension of Rs 42,000, with the Rajasthan Assembly secretariat processing his application following his resignation.

title: 'Less than 50 weapons': IAF on Op Sindoor; reveals why Pak asked for ceasefire
content: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari recounted Operation Sindoor, revealing that fewer than 50 weapons strikes by the IAF on Pakistani military targets compelled Islamabad to request a ceasefire by May 10. These precision strikes, some hitting targets untouched even in the 1971 war, demonstrated India's air dominance and strategic planning, effectively conveying a strong message while minimizing collateral damage.

title: US embassy to visa applicants in India: This passport service has been discontinued
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the US will discontinue third-party passport collection services for visa applicants. Individuals can collect their passports in person or opt for home delivery at a fee of Rs 1,200. For applicants under 18, a parent or guardian must collect the passport with an original consent letter from both parents and required identification.

title: Israeli airstrike kills Houthi rebel PM Ahmed al-Rahawi in Sanaa
content: Israeli airstrikes in Sanaa, Yemen, resulted in the death of Ahmed al-Rahawi, the Houthi prime minister, along with several ministers during a government workshop. The Israeli military confirmed targeting a Houthi site, amidst ongoing Houthi attacks on Israel and Red Sea shipping in support of Palestinians. Earlier strikes this week in Sanaa caused numerous casualties, escalating tensions in the region.

title: 'False & baseless': PIB busts Pakistan claim of India's S-400 hit; clarifies image origin
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has refuted Pakistan's propaganda claiming India's S-400 air defence system was damaged during Operation Sindoor. PIB clarified that reports of destruction are false, and the circulated image is from a 2010 Russian parade. India launched Operation Sindoor after the Pahalgam terror attack, striking terror hubs, and intercepted Pakistani drones and missiles using the S-400.

title: Gmail security alert: Google ‘warns’ 2.5 billion users; How to protect account
content: Google alerted 2.5 billion Gmail users to a critical security threat following breaches that compromised user accounts. Phishing scams tricked users into revealing login information and 2FA codes. Google recommends strong passwords, enabling 2FA, scrutinizing emails, and regularly reviewing account activity to mitigate hacking risks. A separate breach involving Google's Salesforce database was linked to ShinyHunters.

title: Watch: Pilot rescued in 30 seconds after dramatic plane crash off Oak Island
content: A pilot, Mark Finkelstein, miraculously survived a plane crash off Oak Island, North Carolina, after his engine failed mid-air. He was rescued within 30 seconds by the Oak Island Water Rescue team after the plane flipped upside down upon impact.

title: PM Modi in China: Meet with Xi, Putin lined up amid Trump tariff strain - list of SCO attendees
content: Tianjin is preparing to host the SCO Summit, with President Xi Jinping welcoming leaders including PM Modi and President Putin. Against a backdrop of global tensions heightened by US tariffs, the summit aims to project China as a stabilizing force and foster unity among the Global South. Discussions will likely encompass counterterrorism, trade, and a multipolar world order.

title: Yellow brick road’ under Pacific: Volcanic rock revealed; deep sea mystery inspires awe
content: Deep in the Pacific, researchers aboard the E/V Nautilus discovered a peculiar, yellow brick road-like structure at nearly 3,000 meters. Initially sparking Atlantis comparisons, the formation is actually a hyaloclastite, shaped by ancient volcanic activity. This finding highlights the vast unknown of the deep sea and offers insights into the Pacific Ocean floor's volcanic history and Earth's crust evolution.

title: Tesla bull on Nvidia CEO: Jensen is 10% politician; shares take on company stock
content: Tesla investor Dan Ives praises Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang. Ives addresses geopolitical risks between the US and China. Nvidia aims to sell Blackwell chips in China. The company is willing to meet US government terms. Ives is optimistic about Nvidia's future. He predicts Nvidia's market value could reach $5 trillion by early 2026. He now favors Nvidia over Palantir stock.

title: Will Pakistan travel to India for Jr Men's WC 2025? Hockey India reveals
content: Pakistan's junior hockey team will participate in the FIH Junior Men's Hockey World Cup 2025 in Tamil Nadu. This follows Pakistan's withdrawal from the Asia Cup due to security concerns. The World Cup will be held in Chennai and Madurai. India and Pakistan are in Pool B. New policies allow Indian participation in events with Pakistani athletes.

title: Pen cap stuck in lung for 26 yrs: Delhi doctors remove object; express shock
content: A Delhi man lived with a pen cap lodged in his lung for 26 years after accidentally swallowing it as a child. Doctors at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital successfully removed the object, a rare case due to the lack of immediate complications.

title: 'Good to see such fear': RJD MP claims RSS 'sleeper cell' abused PM
content: RJD MP Sudhakar Singh alleged that BJP and RSS "sleeper cells" orchestrated the abuse directed at PM Modi during a Bihar opposition rally, echoing Congress's claim of planted "BJP agents." This follows a viral video showing unidentified men hurling abuses at PM Modi and his mother during Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra.

title: Allu Kanaka Ratnamma's demise: Allu Arjun meets Chiranjeevi - Watch
content: Allu Arjun returned to Hyderabad from Mumbai following the demise of his grandmother, Allu Kanaka Ratnamma. He was seen at the Allu residence, joined by numerous Telugu film personalities offering condolences. Megastar Chiranjeevi and Allu Arjun shared an emotional moment. Director Trivikram Srinivas and producer Naga Vamsi were also present.

title: Tighter US visa norms: Students rethink choices; universities brace for impact
content: Proposed changes to US student visa rules could limit international student stays to four years, replacing the flexible “duration of status” model. This move is expected to impact Indian students more than their Chinese counterparts, as many Indians depend on post-study work routes such as OPT and H-1B visas. Chinese students often pursue funded PhDs or return home, facing less disruption. The shift may prompt Indian students to consider alternative destinations like the UK, Germany, and Australia.

title: Patrick & Brittany Mahomes: Motherhood’s emotional toll on NFL star’s wife
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes and mother of three, recently shared her experiences with the challenges of motherhood. She highlighted the difficulty of balancing personal time with childcare responsibilities and confessed to struggling with mom guilt when accepting help or leaving her children. Despite these struggles, she remains a dedicated supporter of her husband's NFL career.

title: Shubman Gill, Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah reach BCCI's CoE for fitness tests
content: The BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru is buzzing with activity as Indian cricketers gear up for upcoming tournaments. Rohit Sharma, along with Jasprit Bumrah, Shubman Gill, and others, underwent pre-season fitness tests under Adrian le Roux. Discussions are ongoing about Rohit potentially playing for India 'A' before the Australia series.

title: 'India, a long live economy': Shivraj slams Trump’s ‘dead economy’ remark
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Chouhan refuted Donald Trump's "dead economy" remark, citing India's 7.8% GDP growth in April-June. BJP leaders criticized Rahul Gandhi for supporting Trump's statement, highlighting the strong economic figures as evidence of India's progress under Prime Minister Modi's leadership towards becoming a developed and self-reliant nation.

title: Rahul offers candies to black-flag protesters in Bihar - watch
content: During his 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, Rahul Gandhi faced black flag protests from BJYM workers over alleged remarks against PM Modi. In a surprising gesture, Gandhi offered candies to the protesters. He also accused the BJP, RSS, and Election Commission of 'vote chori' during the ongoing electoral roll revision, claiming it's an attack on the Constitution.

title: Watch: Chinese chess player spends 4 hours in heavy rain after loss
content: A video shows a Chinese man analysing his chess loss in the rain. Grandmaster Hans Niemann shared a similar experience. Anish Giri joked about his rain-free victory. Niemann criticised the American chess system, praising India's support for players. Divya Deshmukh received a Rs 3 crore prize for her chess achievements. Chess passion continues to inspire globally.

title: Lord of Sakar uncovered: 2,100-year-old Thracian warrior tomb
content: Bulgaria showcases Hellenistic heritage at the National Archaeological Institute. The exhibition features treasures from a Thracian warrior's tomb. The warrior is known as the Lord of Sakar. Gold artifacts, jewelry, and horse accessories are on display. The discovery reveals Thracian craftsmanship and culture. The warrior's grave is the most opulent found in Bulgaria.

title: Mayhem! 11 sixes in 12 balls: India batter goes into monster mode
content: Salman Nizar's explosive batting propelled Calicut to an improbable victory in the Kerala Cricket League. Nizar smashed a record-breaking 86 off 26 balls, including 11 sixes in the final two overs, to score 71 runs. This remarkable onslaught transformed a struggling innings into a match-winning total, etching his name in T20 history.

title: 'Horrific murder': Zelenskyy confirms ex-speaker Parubiy shot dead; vows probe
content: A Ukrainian lawmaker and former speaker of parliament, Andriy Parubiy, was fatally shot in Lviv, prompting a swift condemnation from President Volodymyr Zelensky. Zelensky denounced the killing as a "horrific murder" and pledged a thorough investigation into the incident. Authorities have mobilized all available resources to investigate the crime and apprehend the perpetrator, as confirmed by the president.

title: Jason Kelce banned: ESPN blocks star from YouTube's Chargers vs Chiefs stream
content: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: 'After Awadh, now Magadh': Akhilesh jabs BJP at Rahul's Bihar rally; slams RSS
content: Akhilesh Yadav has criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's claim about Indians sharing the same DNA for 40,000 years, turning it into a political jab during a rally in Bihar. Yadav referenced the BJP's losses in Uttar Pradesh and called for a similar defeat in Bihar, while also pledging support to Tejashwi Yadav in the upcoming assembly polls.

title: Conor McGregor vs Nate Diaz: UFC's fiercest rivalry hits White House stage
content: Nate Diaz has hinted at a potential third fight with Conor McGregor, suggesting it could happen at a special UFC event on July 4, 2026, at the White House. Dana White has confirmed the event, which is planned as part of America's 250th Independence Day celebrations. Both fighters have expressed interest, fueling anticipation for the long-awaited trilogy fight.

title: 'Financial ruin' for US? What happens if Trump tariffs are struck down by court — Explained
content: A US federal court has dealt President Trump a blow, ruling his sweeping tariffs illegal, stating he exceeded his authority by declaring trade deficits as national emergencies. While the tariffs remain during appeal to the Supreme Court, businesses face continued uncertainty. A potential $159 billion refund looms if the ruling stands, weakening Trump's negotiating power.

title: Security lapse! Babar Azam chased, hugged and kissed by fan during match in Pakistan
content: Despite Babar Azam's Asia Cup 2025 exclusion, his popularity remains high. A fan breached security during a veterans' match, hugging and kissing him. Selectors dropped Azam and Rizwan, citing other players' form, appointing Salman Agha captain. The squad includes Mohammad Wasim, Salman Mirza, and Fakhar Zaman.

title: From Puri to Delhi: Jagannath Rath Yatra wheels to adorn Parliament
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has approved a proposal to install three wheels from the Puri Rath Yatra chariots in the Parliament premises. The Shree Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA) presented the proposal during Birla's visit to Puri. Each wheel will represent the chariots of Lord Jagannath, Devi Subhadra, and Lord Balabhadra, symbolizing Odisha's rich cultural and spiritual heritage.

title: Dravid, Pandit and more: Full list of coach, player changes since IPL 2025
content: Following IPL 2025, Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid steps down after a long association, while Kolkata Knight Riders sees the departure of head coach Chandrakant Pandit and bowling coach Bharat Arun. Pandit, despite leading KKR to a title in 2024, exits after a challenging 2025 season, with Abhishek Nayar returning as assistant coach.

title: Panic at petrol pump: Staff shot for refusing fuel to helmetless youths in MP
content: In Bhind district, Madhya Pradesh, a petrol pump worker was shot and injured for refusing to serve fuel to two helmetless youths, adhering to district rules. The enraged youths returned with firearms, and one opened fire, injuring the worker. Police have identified the accused from CCTV footage and eyewitness accounts and are pursuing their arrest.

title: Maratha quota stir: Traffic comes to standstill in Mumbai — Top developments
content: Manoj Jarange's hunger strike in Mumbai intensifies, demanding a 10% Maratha quota under the OBC category without reducing existing OBC reservations. Jarange warns the government against testing the community's patience, accusing them of misinformation. Traffic in South Mumbai is disrupted as protesters gather, coinciding with the Ganesh festival.

title: 'Discriminatory': Putin blasts Western sanctions against Russia
content: Ahead of his China visit, Vladimir Putin criticized Western sanctions, citing their role in Russia's economic recession due to trade restrictions and Ukraine war costs. He lauded growing Russia-China ties, highlighting increased trade and cooperation across various sectors. Both nations reject discriminatory trade measures, focusing on strengthening economic partnerships and transactions in rubles and yuan.

title: ‘Param Sundari’ box office collection day 2 (Live)
content: Param Sundari, starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, released this Friday. The film earned Rs 3.97 crore on Saturday. Its total collection now stands at Rs 11.22 crore. The movie maintains pace with other romantic comedies released in 2025. Param Sundari had an overall occupancy of 13.85% on Saturday.

title: Princess Diana's time capsule opened: What was found and revealed
content: A time capsule linked to Princess Diana, sealed three decades ago, has been opened, revealing a snapshot of the early 1990s. Contents include a Kylie Minogue CD, a pocket television, and period newspapers and magazines. The capsule offers insights into Diana's life, her connection to pop culture, and the social landscape of the era.

title: Watch: MP school teacher caught drunk, lying half-undressed in viral video; suspended
content: Anjani Kumar Saket, a government school teacher in Mauganj district, Madhya Pradesh, has been suspended after a video went viral showing him drunk and partially undressed on school grounds during working hours.

title: Over 500 drones fired at Ukraine: One killed, dozens injured in Russian attack
content: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Ukraine overnight, resulting in one death and at least 24 injuries. Ukrainian President Zelenskiy reported over 500 drones and 45 missiles targeted 14 regions. In retaliation, Ukraine struck two Russian oil refineries, causing explosions and fires. These events unfold amidst stalled diplomatic efforts, with Zelenskiy urging fresh sanctions on Russia's banking and energy sectors.

title: Watch: Man blames his HIV as ‘act of god’, steals from temple donation boxes
content: A 45-year-old HIV+ man in Chhattisgarh, driven by anger after contracting the virus in prison, confessed to a decade-long looting spree targeting temples in Durg. He stole from donation boxes to express his resentment towards God, believing his infection was an "act of god." Police apprehended him after a recent theft, recovering coins and his two-wheeler.

title: Chargesheet filed against two for falsely implicating beauty parlour owner in drug case
content: Parlour owner spent 72 days in jail on charge of possession on LSD stamps, which were later found to be fake. Chargesheet filed against her daughter-in-law’s sister and her friend

title: Arvind Bellad takes exception to Vidhana Soudha’s banquet hall being used for private function
content: He condemned the government for allowing a felicitation programme marking 50 years of professional service of former Advocate General Prof. Ravivarmakumar to be held at the hall

title: Nagaland medical students stage protest against govt decision to regularise 280 health workers
content: They argued that the government’s decision to bypass written exams for Class-I posts sets a dangerous precedent. Under the Nagaland Health Service Rules, recruitment for such posts requires 100% selection through NPSC.

title: Krishi Mela should help farmers tackle emerging challenges in farm sector: Santosh Lad
content: The farm fair, to be conducted from Sept. 13 to 16, is an important platform to provide farmers with information on new farm technologies, cropping methods and value addition to farm produce, he stresses

title: Government to replace the Ordinance on 42% reservations for BCs with a Bill in the Assembly on Sunday
content: The Panchayat Raj Act passed in 2018 during the previous BRS regime was the biggest hurdle as it capped total reservations for SCs, STs and BCs in local bodies at 50%, Minister Ponnam Prabhakar explained

title: Stepfather gets 55 years rigorous imprisonment for abusing minor girl
content: The accused has been fined ₹40,000. Failure to remit the fine will entail an additional two years and four months of imprisonment

title: Shivaji was not anti-Muslim, asserts Minister Lad
content: Shivaji Maharaj fought for the protection of all castes and religions, and he should not be confined only to the Maratha community, he states

title: 1,910 students graduate from NIT-C
content: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar says NIT-C was the first such institute in the country to get designated by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs as a ‘centre of excellence in urban planning and designing’

title: Modi reaffirms India's support for Ukraine peace settlement during call with Zelenskyy
content: During call with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, PM Modi discusses bilateral partnership progress and reaffirms support for peace in Ukraine

title: Karnataka HC directs Centre  to file response on interim plea on online gaming bill
content: The court has adjourned to September 8 the hearing on a petition challenging the Constitutional validity of the newly-enacted Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming (PROG) Act, 2025

title: Traffic grinds to a halt on NH stretch between Mudikkode and Peechi
content: Congestion lasts for a few hours, with hundreds of vehicles stranded. Both the service road and the main carriageway remained clogged. The collapse of the Mudikkode service road cited as primary reason for the gridlock

title: e-Health services gain momentum in Kottayam
content: e-Health facility to be implemented in nine more places this year in Kottayam. The facility is available in 45 centres out of 88 hospitals in the district currently

title: Minister releases digital magazine of students’ works
content: Mazha Mannilezhuthiyathu includes students’ writings, paintings and cartoons that featured at the Kerala State School Arts Festival this year

title: Shed fear of attrition and invest boldly in Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu exhorts industrialists
content: Six MoUs worth ₹2,000 crore signed in the presence of Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, and they have a potential to generate 18,000 jobs

title: Victims of human-wildlife conflict, their kin should be made aware of legal rights, says SC judge
content: Judges speaking at a regional meet on human-wildlife conflicts call for a holistic, ecocentric approach to the issue

title: CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh govt. to release ₹10,000 crore for permanent Budameru flood prevention
content: Party says government has failed to implement lasting solutions since last year’s floods, leaving Vijayawada residents at risk

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar seeks pension from Rajasthan Assembly as former MLA
content: The pension from the State Assembly payable to Dhankhar will be in addition to the pension he will draw as the former Vice-President and an ex-MP

title: Projects worth ₹180 crore to be launched at Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: Development projects worth ₹717.29 crore are ongoing at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital. First phase projects have been completed and those in the second phase are at various stages of construction

title: Yadgir teen pregnancy case: Probe by retired district judge ordered
content: The Karnataka Residential Educational Institutions Society (KREIS) has ordered an investigation by a retired district judge into the case of a class 9 student delivering a baby in a government-run school in the Yadgir district.

title: Incessant rain triggers landslides in northern West Bengal; National Highway 10 closed
content: The closure of NH10 has affected the main route connecting Sikkim and West Bengal; restoration work is underway

title: Family protests woman’s death after C-Section at Belagavi government hospital
content: Inquiry will be initiated and the concerned staff, if found guilty, shall be punished, says Taluk Health Officer

title: Ganesh idols made with ‘unique objects’ dot streets of Tirupati
content: Expert says that since ages, generations of painters and sculptors have taken the creative liberty to portray Lord Ganesh in different ways, however, this year’s idols have strictly adhered to divine themes as against the contemporary developments

title: Thrissur Corporation moves to disqualify six BJP councillors
content: Action planned under provisions of the Municipal Act and the Local Self-Government Election Act for allegedly spreading propaganda and filing cases that led to financial losses for the local  body

title: Maoists kill ‘shikshadoot’ in Chhattisgarh, sixth this year
content: Police sources said ‘shikshadoots’ are being targeted on suspicion of being police informers. Bastar Inspector General of Police P. Sundarraj said Maoists are killing teachers as they want to deprive the native population of education

title: Group of Ministers to recommend how to use the palatial buildings at Rushikonda in Vizag
content: The GoM, as per G.O. RT NO. 1586, can empanel special invitees, if required, and is mandated to submit its recommendations at the earliest

title: Tourist terminal for houseboats at Kumarakom fails to take off
content: The terminal, built at at a cost of ₹3.29 crore with a capacity to accommodate up to 40 houseboats and located at a prime location along one of the most scenic stretches of Vembanad Lake, has remained largely unused even six years after its formal inauguration.

title: Centre directs Kerala to submit DPR for seaplane service project
content: State government seeks response of KIIFCON-RITES, a joint venture which was entrusted with the task of holding a feasibility study on setting up airstrips in Idukki, Wayanad and Kasaragod districts, on preparing the DPR for seaplane project in three months

title: Vigil stepped up in Kozhikode ahead of Onam to track drug peddlers
content: The anti-narcotics squads have already collaborated with the special squads of the Excise, Railway Protection Force, and the Motor Vehicles departments to ensure strict vigil at all possible public spots

title: What does the Supreme Court’s push to regulate social media mean for free speech?
content: Experts told The Hindu that any new regulations for India’s digital media must be framed with care to avoid infringing on freedom of expression

title: Indian economy to sustain high growth momentum in coming quarters: CEA Nageswaran
content: “The Centre, along with various stakeholders, are actively working overtime to cushion the export sector from the U.S. tariffs,” the CEA said

title: Warangal unit of Kitex begins commercial production
content: Comes at a time when infant and children’s apparel explores new markets and seeks to reduce reliance on the mainstay U.S.

title: Bringing Krishna waters to Kuppam a defining moment in my political journey, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Recalling the strenuous efforts in making it a reality and the periods of setbacks the project faced, particularly during the YSRCP term, the Chief Minister reiterates the plan to take up Polavaram-Banakacherla project to drive away drought in Rayalaseema

title: Give priority to concrete road to Edmalakkudy, Collector tells PWD
content: Collector’s directive follows death of two persons due to delayed medical care in  the absence of proper road connectivity to the tribal panchayat

title: BRS stages protests on urea crisis in State on Day 1 of Assembly session
content: KTR says their party is ready to debate on any issue, but urea is priority subject now when compared to other issues

title: Dash cams help police crack crashes, catch culprits, cut confusion
content: TGSRTC buses as well vehicles plying for school/educational institutions have been ordered to install and use dash cams

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu releases Krishna waters into Kuppam tank
content: It marks the completion of the final stretch of the Handri-Neeva Sujala Sravanthi project in Chittoor district; farmers now hope to galvanise agricultural activity as the waters will help fill 110 tanks and irrigate about 6,300 acres of ayacut

title: Pulwama attack may have been orchestrated to win 2019 polls, alleges CPI’s Amarjeet Kaur
content: She questions why the government didn’t take action despite prior intelligence warnings about a major terror strike, as revealed by the then J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik

title: 2.6 lakh devotees likely to attend Sirimanotsavam in Vizianagaram on October 7
content: MSME Minister directs officials to ensure that the event concludes between 3 p.m. and 5 p.m. to avoid inconvenience to devotees

title: ‘Planned obstructions’ in Parliament not a healthy sign for democracy, says Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
content: Language and behaviour of people’s representatives should remain dignified inside House and outside, he reiterates

title: Asaram surrenders after Rajasthan High Court refuses to extend interim bail
content: Referring to the medical report by Government Hospital, Ahmedabad, the court stated that Asaram’s health condition is stable, and he does not require hospitalisation or continuous medical care

title: Support for Ayyappa sangamam only if traditions remain intact, says NSS
content: G. Sukumaran Nair says that the event is indeed welcome if doesn’t disrupt the customs and traditions of the Sabarimala Ayyappa Temple.

title: ‘Yadgir will be developed under Aspirational Districts Programme’
content: District sanctioned ₹16 crore under the programme and it will receive additional special grants once it demonstrates progress, says Lavish Ordia

title: Third National Lok Adalat in Yadgir on September 13
content: 19,632 cases are pending in all courts in the district of which 3,003 cases have been identified for settlement, says Judge Marula Siddaradhya

title: NALSA awareness camp highlights legal aid for marginalised communities in Guntur
content: Financial assistance of ₹71 lakh distributed to 108 beneficiaries, while women received autorickshaws, and differently-abled persons were given hearing aids, smartphones and wheelchairs

title: Warship enters Panama Canal: Large buildup of US forces in Caribbean
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of the Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Forces Worked In Complete Synergy During Op Sindoor: Air Force Ex-Chief To NDTV
content: Operation Sindoor was an example of all three armed forces working in "complete synergy", former Indian Air Force chief Vivek Ram Chaudhari has said.

title: Swimmers Face Fecal Contamination At Beaches Along US Coastline
content: Thousands of Americans will head to beaches for one last summer splash this Labor Day weekend, but taking a dip might be out of the question.

title: Handshakes, Smiles, Performances: How PM Modi Was Welcomed By Indian Diaspora In China
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome from the Indian diaspora on Saturday as he arrived at Binhai International Airport in Tianjin for a two-day official visit to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in China.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Applies For Pension As Rajasthan Ex-MLA
content: Former vice-president of India Jagdeep Dhankhar has applied for a pension as a former legislator in Rajasthan, officials said.

title: NDTV Defence Summit Highlights: Forces Worked In Complete Synergy During Op Sindoor, Says Ex-Air Force Chief
content: NDTV is back with its annual premier event, the Defence Summit. This year's conclave focuses on "Warfare in the 21st Century" and Operation Sindoor.

title: Ukrainian Former Parliamentary Speaker Shot Dead
content: A Ukrainian lawmaker who formerly served as speaker of parliament was shot dead, in what President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned as a "horrific murder".

title: 3 Dead After Mob Sets Fire To Indonesian Regional Parliament Building
content: An angry mob set fire to a local parliament building in an Indonesian provincial capital, leaving at least three people dead and five others hospitalised.

title: "Stigma Has To Be On Perpetrator, Not Victim": Delhi High Court On Rape Case
content: The Delhi High Court has termed as "obnoxious" the submission of an accused that quashing rape proceedings against him would be in the interest of the minor victim who otherwise would have to face "stigma".

title: New $250 Visa Fee Risks Deepening US Travel Slump
content: A new $250 "visa integrity fee" imposed on travelers to the United States risks piling more pressure on the struggling travel industry, as overseas arrivals continue to fall due to President Donald Trump's crackdown on immigration.

title: One Dead, Five Injured As Car Slams Into Crowd In France
content: A man intentionally ploughed his car into a crowd outside a wine bar in northern France after an altercation, killing one person and injuring five others, two of them critically.

title: Thailand's Rival Camps Jostle To Fill Power Void After Paetongtarn Shinawatra's Ouster
content: Thailand's political rivals jockeyed for power after a court sacked the prime minister, with two camps declaring they were ready to form the next government but with no indication when that might happen.

title: Teacher Saves 19-Year-Old NEET Student From Dying By Suicide In Jaipur
content: A teacher saved a 19-year-old NEET aspirant who attempted to end her life by jumping off the terrace of a coaching institute here, police said on Saturday.

title: NDTV Defence Summit 2025: Women Officers From 2 Different Generations Trace Changes In Armed Forces
content: Two women officers of the armed forces who represent different generations explained the leaps and bounds in the services and the generational progress that has taken place.

title: Body Found In Train Toilet In Bhubaneswar Railway Station
content: Police on Saturday recovered the body of a man from the toilet of the Bhubaneswar-Tirupati Superfast Express at Bhubaneswar railway station, an officer said.

title: PM Modi In China After 7 Years, Set To Meet Xi Jinping Tomorrow
content: Trump's 50% tariffs on India, including a 25% 'penalty' for buying Russian oil, are being seen as having brought New Delhi closer to both Beijing and Moscow.

title: BRS Leader KT Rama Rao Detained For Protest Rally Over Urea Crisis
content: High drama unfolded in the heart of Hyderabad today as leaders of the BRS party, including Working President KT Rama Rao and former Minister T Harish Rao, were detained by police during a protest rally over the state's ongoing urea crisis.

title: PM Modi China Visit LIVE: PM Modi Arrives In China For Regional SCO Summit
content: PM Modi China Visit Day-1 LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in China on Saturday on a keenly watched visit that assumed greater significance in view of sudden downturn in India-US ties triggered by Washington's policies on tariff.

title: Assam Intensifying Crackdown On Infiltrators On 2 Fronts: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam is intensifying its crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immigrants with a two-front approach, said Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, adding that his government would not be restricted to daily pushback operations against infiltrators.

title: "BrahMos Can Be Answer For Foreign Policy": Expert At NDTV Defence Summit
content: The BrahMos supersonic cruise missile can be the "answer for India's foreign policy," said the former Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of BrahMos Aerospace, Atul Dinkar Rane.

title: Mehul Choksi's Bail Plea Rejected By Belgian Court Of Appeal
content: The bail plea of fugitive diamonds trader Mehul Choksi, wanted in India in connection with over Rs 6300-crore fraud in the Punjab National Bank, has again been turned down by a court of appeal in Belgium, just ahead of his extradition hearing
